Infectum.text: Maḥtənne, maḥti maye aʕlayye, maḥtənne bayn am maye. Kfayxi, kfǝrdi (2018_07_01_01.2_Arkah_Ishaq_old_houses_ED: 017) (The burnt limestone crumbles in the water); Kfǝrḏi, kowən čimənto, d əmmina, uʕdo kəmmina čimənto (018)
gǝmfaradno u laḥmo bayn a tlawḥe. I will crumble the bread in the lentil (soup). (Ilyas p.c)
gǝmfaradno ak kallawatayḏi kulle. I will change all my money. (Ilyas p.c)
gǝmfaradno u šakar bi čaye. I will crumble the sugar in the tea.(Ilyas p.c)

Preterit.text: mfaradli mo waroqe b ʕaṣro ʕaṣrowat. I changed hundred liras for ten tens. (Ilyas p.c)

Infectum.text: ko maḥti maye aʕlayye w ko maḥtənne bayn am maye,  ko mifardi (Ilyas p.c.)  They put/pour water on them and they put them in water, they crumble.(Ilyas p.c)
u laḥmo ko mifarad  bayn a tlawḥe (Ilyas p.c). The bread is crumbled in the lentil (soup). (Ilyas p.c)

Preterit.text: mfardi aḥ ḥeṭe maš šǝble. The wheats were taken out of ears.(Ilyas p.c)
mfardi ak kefe du šuro.  The stones were taken out of the wall.(Ilyas p.c)
mfardi aʕ ʕǝnwe maṣ suġle [meqǝm ruḥayye]. Grapes were taken out from bunch. (Ilyas p.c)

idioms: frd/frḏ (cf. Kurd. firdikîn être émietté KFD 506; RW 64 fərḏino/ fərḏuno m, pl –e Krume; Ilyas says farduno)
to crumble (intr.) [Note: in Kfarze, this meaning is rendered by the II stem detransitive]
